terms.definition: A professional responsible for developing new products from initial concept through production, ensuring they meet specifications and safety standards.
The process of creating, organizing, and maintaining written records of technical specifications, processes, and procedures for reference and compliance.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing teams to work with the most current version and revert to previous versions if needed.
A single, unified platform where all project documentation is stored, accessed, and managed to eliminate information silos.
A chronological record of all changes, edits, and access events for documents, providing accountability and compliance tracking.
Isolated information systems or databases that prevent easy sharing and access of data across different departments or teams.
Security measures that determine who can view, edit, or manage specific documents and what level of permissions they have.
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to regulatory standards, safety requirements, and industry regulations.
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously edit and collaborate on documents with changes appearing instantly for all participants.
The use of software to automatically execute routine documentation tasks like approvals, notifications, and status updates without manual intervention.
Software platform that stores, organizes, tracks, and controls electronic documents and their versions throughout their lifecycle.
Groups of people with different functional expertise working together toward a common goal, requiring coordinated documentation and communication.
Detailed written requirements that define the exact criteria, dimensions, materials, and performance standards for a product or system.
The process of ensuring products and processes comply with government regulations, industry standards, and safety requirements.
The ability of a documentation platform to connect and work seamlessly with other software tools and systems used in the development process.
